intro: Heracleum sibiricum subsp. longifolium, commonly known as Siberian cow parsley, is a member of the Apiaceae family and is native to eastern Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and large, umbrella-shaped inflorescences that produce small white or greenish-yellow flowers. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its aromatic foliage and showy flowers make it a distinctive and ecologically important plant in its native range.
